menus.description: Welcome to Kendal the home of Olrig Bank
Links to sites that will keep you abreast about what is happening
Range far and wide without the car!
Places we where we love to eat
A wide variety of local activities
Shops that can be just a delight to wander around
Hopefully full of objects that all over 100 years old and curated by people with years of experience
Collectable is in the eye of the collector!
Gatherings that are still come this year

offerings.title: The Visit Kendal Site
offerings.description: The easiest way to find out what is going on in the town during your stay

offerings.title: Baba Ganoush
offerings.description: What a place! When it is open

offerings.title: Kendal People Cafe
offerings.description: A great place to eat and to see a community in action

offerings.title: Kendal Castle
offerings.description: The first walk to take after you have settled in to Olrig Bank!

offerings.title: Kendal Climbing Wall
offerings.description: Kids climbing the walls? Why not visit the Kendal Climbing Wall!

offerings.title: Watson & Wollard
offerings.description: A high quality traditional local butcher on the marketplace

offerings.title: Ruskins
offerings.description: Popular town centre bar with regular live music from acoustic jam nights to reggae, folk nights to electronica - with the odd quiz night inbetween - Ruskins is a hidden gem on Kendal high street

offerings.title: The Kendal Mountain Festival
offerings.description: The Everest of Festivals

offerings.title: The Lakes International Comic Art Festival
offerings.description: A fun family festival that has grown and grown over the last 10 years

offerings.title: The Brewery
offerings.description: Attracts great acts

offerings.title: Kendal Music Feastival
offerings.description: Kendal's Annual music Feastival

offerings.title: Kendal Jazz club
offerings.description: New to the Brewery

offerings.title: The Staff Of Life
offerings.description: An absolutely lovely bakery

offerings.title: Kendal Fish & Seafoods
offerings.description: A great fishmonger on Stramongate

offerings.title: The Nutshell
offerings.description: A gem, Crammed to the rafters with stuff! some of it is very valuable

offerings.title: The Joshua Tree
offerings.description: Provides a great English Breakfast and wonderful lunches

offerings.title: The Old Curiosity Shop
offerings.description: A modern take on The Nutshell?

offerings.title: The Fell
offerings.description: An absolutely cracking bar with atmosphere and games

offerings.title: Serpentine Woods
offerings.description: From Noble's Rest Park it is short upwards walk to the entrance to the woods

offerings.title: Cunswick Scar and Scout Scar
offerings.description: Starting from the Serpentine Woods a 7.25 mile circular route that Wainright described as: a walk above others, a pleasure every step of the way

offerings.title: Craggy Wood
offerings.description: Park in the village of Staverly. Walk past the bowling Green, cross a small stream and walk through a farm. From there you can find a circular route that takes you through these atmospheric woods , ending on a downhill walk though fields of sheep and back to the village

offerings.title: Gummer's How
offerings.description: An easy walk to a magnificent view over Windermere

offerings.title: Fell Foot Park
offerings.description: Lakeshore park with stunning mountain views, Boathouse cafe, watersports hire and play area

offerings.title: Cycling around Kendal
offerings.description: courtesy of the Kendal Mountain Festival

offerings.title: The Albion Social & Snooker Club
offerings.description: Excellent snooker tables. Well-kept real ales at reasonable prices. Free entry for CAMRA members.

offerings.title: Kendal Walking Festival
offerings.description: This well established festival continues to demonstrate why Kendal makes a superb base for those who enjoy walking. Surrounded by beautiful scenery it offers a wide variety of walking experiences. It is a 5-minute drive into the Lake District National Park and 20 minutes from the Yorkshire Dales. In addition we have Arnside and Silverdale Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty just a few miles south of town.  We really do have it all....mountains, lakes, rivers, valleys and the wide open vistas of Morecambe Bay!!

offerings.title: Olrig Bank
offerings.description: A fine place to stay

offerings.title: Ingleborough Cave
offerings.description: A visit could give you a taste for serious caving

offerings.title: Ring O Bells
offerings.description: Historic, quirky and charismatic local pub serving real ales and food homemade by landlady Su. Enjoy a drink in the cosy Bell Ringers Snug. Rumounred to be folk music sessions each Monday evening.

offerings.title: Abbot Hall
offerings.description: One of the UK''s leading art galleries. Established in 1962 in a Grade I listed Georgian building on the banks of the River Kent in Kendal, today we are rethinking the gallery as vibrant cultural and community hub.

offerings.title: The Quaker Tapestry
offerings.description: The story of Quakers in 77 embroidered panels

offerings.title: The Helm
offerings.description: Situated near Oxenholme, just south east of Kendal and although not a very high hill at 185m, it gives beautiful views.

offerings.title: Gurnal Dubs Tarn
offerings.description: A beautiful tarn below the minor summit of Ulgraves, not far from the village of Staveley. On the walk in, you are rewarded with superb views across nearby Kendal. Although it is actually an artificial tarn, it still makes for a lovely spot for a wild swim in summer.

offerings.title: Rock Climbing
offerings.description: The Lakes is the ideal place to take a beginners course

offerings.title: Sizergh Fell Walk
offerings.description: The traditional agricultural estate that surrounds Sizergh offers dramatic views of the Lakeland Fells, the Pennines and Morecambe Bay, as well as a fantastic array of animals, birds, butterflies and wildflowers that vary with the seasons.

offerings.title: Park End Moss Wetland
offerings.description: Park End Moss Wetland wWlk at Sizergh was once an area of degraded farmland that has now been transformed into a haven for wildlife. This circular walk takes you through historic parkland and ancient woodlands of the Sizergh estate and on to the wetland area which is popular with a variety of bird species.

offerings.title: The Bay Cycle Way
offerings.description: Kendal to the Arnside, Silverdale, Beetham loop
